decks.notes: The main concept of this Jeskai Aggro deck is to quickly establish board presence with low-cost creatures like Imodane's Recruiter and Knight-Errant of Eos, while disrupting the opponent's game plan with cards like Spyglass Siren and Novice Inspector. Resolute Reinforcements allows for an aggressive push, while Case of the Gateway Express can provide additional late-game power. The deck aims to overwhelm the opponent with a combination of efficient creatures and disruptive spells, utilizing a mix of white, blue, and red mana sources for flexibility and consistency.

This Sultai Aggro deck focuses on a combination of aggressive creatures and disruption spells to control the board and pressure the opponent. It aims to quickly deploy threats like Hostile Investigator and Sheoldred, the Apocalypse to apply pressure, while also disrupting the opponent's game plan with cards like Duress and Go for the Throat. With a mix of efficient removal, card advantage engines like Liliana of the Veil, and powerful finishers like Lazav, Wearer of Faces, the deck looks to overwhelm opponents with a combination of tempo and raw power.

The main concept of this Azorius Aggro deck is to overwhelm the opponent with a fast and aggressive strategy. By playing efficient creatures like Regal Bunnicorn, Spyglass Siren, and Steel Seraph, along with disruptive cards like Get Lost and Spring-Loaded Sawblades, the deck aims to establish early board presence and apply pressure to the opponent. With a mix of flying and ground creatures, along with some card advantage from Novice Inspector and Mirrex, the deck seeks to outpace the opponent and secure victory quickly.

This Jeskai Control deck focuses on disrupting the opponent's strategy through a combination of counterspells, removal spells, and card draw. The goal is to control the game by managing the board and hand advantage, while gradually gaining control and setting up for a win condition. By utilizing cards like Lightning Helix for removal and Jace, the Perfected Mind for card advantage, the deck aims to outvalue the opponent and outlast them in a battle of attrition. Deduce and Torch the Tower provide additional control options, while Sunfall and Caretaker's Talent offer ways to maintain card advantage.

This deck focuses on utilizing a variety of control spells and abilities to manage and disrupt your opponent's strategy while building up your own board presence. With a mix of creatures like Archangel of Wrath and Atraxa, Grand Unifier, along with spells like Leyline Binding and Temporary Lockdown, you can maintain control of the game while setting up for a powerful finish. The deck also includes ramp cards like Heaped Harvest and Up the Beanstalk to accelerate your mana production and get ahead of your opponent. Overall, this deck aims to outlast and outmaneuver your opponent through careful resource management and strategic plays.

The main concept of this deck is to overwhelm the opponent with a fast and aggressive strategy using efficient creatures and spells to quickly establish board control and deal damage. The deck focuses on establishing an early presence on the battlefield with low-cost creatures like Novice Inspector and Spyglass Siren, while also utilizing powerful finishers such as Steel Seraph and Regal Bunnicorn. The deck's mana base allows for consistent access to both white and blue mana sources, enabling a smooth curve of plays and maintaining pressure on the opponent throughout the game.

The main idea of this deck is to quickly overwhelm your opponent with aggressive creatures and fast removal spells. By efficiently using mana and playing creatures like Iridescent Vinelasher and Thought-Stalker Warlock early on, you can apply pressure and control the board. Fireglass Mentor and Gev, Scaled Scorch provide additional support and allow you to maintain aggression. Cards like Lightning Strike and Go for the Throat offer removal options to deal with any threats your opponent may have. Overall, the strategy is to be fast and relentless in attacking your opponent.

The main focus of this deck is to control the game by utilizing cards that disrupt the opponent's strategy, such as Deduce, Get Lost, and Temporary Lockdown. The deck also includes tools like Sunfall and Tishana's Tidebinder to maintain control of the board while slowly building up resources. Additionally, there are cards like No More Lies and Three Steps Ahead to manipulate the opponent's hand and future plays. Overall, this UW Control deck aims to outlast the opponent and secure victory through careful planning and resource management.

The deck focuses on utilizing a combination of removal spells and control elements to disrupt the opponent's strategy while steadily building a board presence. It includes a mix of creature removal, card draw, and token generation to maintain control of the game. The deck also incorporates cards that provide additional value, such as gaining life or creating tokens. The land base is designed to support the deck's color requirements and ensure consistency in casting spells. Overall, the Orzhov Control deck aims to outlast the opponent and maintain control of the game until victory.

The main focus of this deck is to quickly overwhelm the opponent with fast and aggressive creatures, supported by combat tricks and burn spells to push through damage. With a low mana curve and efficient creatures like Monastery Swiftspear and Monstrous Rage, the deck aims to deal damage early and often, putting pressure on the opponent to keep up. With a mix of creature-based aggression and direct damage, the deck looks to close out games quickly before the opponent can stabilize.

This deck focuses on quickly building a board presence and overwhelming your opponent with aggressive creatures and combat tricks. By curving out efficiently and utilizing cards like Resolute Reinforcements and Warden of the Inner Sky, you can quickly apply pressure and force your opponent into reactive plays. Gleeful Demolition and Case of the Gateway Express can help clear the way for your creatures to attack and deal damage. By combining efficient creatures with powerful combat spells, this deck aims to win the game before your opponent has a chance to stabilize.

This deck focuses on quickly overwhelming the opponent with aggressive creatures and burn spells. By maximizing damage output and utilizing creatures with powerful abilities, such as Flamecache Gecko and Gev, Scaled Scorch, the deck aims to put pressure on the opponent early and often. With a combination of direct damage spells like Lightning Strike and creature removal like Go for the Throat, the deck can clear the way for its aggressive creatures to push through and secure victory. The mana base is carefully constructed to ensure consistent access to the right colors of mana for casting spells efficiently.

The main focus of this deck is to overwhelm the opponent with aggressive creatures and burn spells. By quickly deploying threats like Monastery Swiftspear and Emberheart Challenger, along with efficient removal like Shock and Lightning Strike, the deck aims to deal damage quickly and efficiently. Charming Scoundrel and Witchstalker Frenzy provide additional ways to pressure the opponent, while cards like Squee, Dubious Monarch and Goddric, Cloaked Reveler offer recurring threats. The inclusion of Mishra's Foundry and Obliterating Bolt gives the deck some versatility and reach in longer games.
